content: 70 sts total round 1 knit all stitches round 2 needle 1 k1 s1 k1 psso k to 3 stitches before end of needle k2tog k1 needle 2 k1 s1 k1 psso k to end of needle needle 3 k to 3 stitches before end of needle k2tog k1 repeat these 2 rounds until 22 sts remain 11 per side kitchener stitch the toe heel us1 2 25mm needles instructions are specifically for dpns note the heel sts may be picked up directly onto the knitting needles or may be picked up with a tapestry needle and waste yarn and then transferred to the knitting needles pick-up the row of sts below the contrast waste yarn 35 sts pick-up the row of stitches above the contrast waste yarn 35 sts 70 total sts for heel remove the contrast waste yarn by picking out each stitch needle 1 35 sts needle 2 17 sts needle 3 18 sts 70 sts total if you generally prefer a deeper heel knit a couple of rounds before starting the heel decreases knit alternating rounds as per toe instructions until 26 sts remain 13 sts per side kitchener stitch the heel if necessary use the tail to close the gap at the corner of the heel by stitching it closed repeat with a small piece of yarn on the second corner if needed knit the second sock weave in all ends block enjoy 3 advent socks chart 1 leg 4 advent socks chart 2 foot 5 advent socks optional colouring charts you may wish to test your colour choices in advance i have indicated the size of the pattern repeat if you want to test several colours holly in the cold dark days of winter when so many plants have gone dormant holly remains bright and green and is a symbol that spring will return it represents the legend of the holly king and the oak king i wish you hope note this is one of the few colourwork sections that is not a simple repeat please pay careful attention in the first row warm winter woolens in my area winters can be long harsh and bitterly cold thick woolen sweaters and accessories are a comfort on even the coldest days i wish you warmth pattern is a 10 stitch repeat snowflakes the pure joy of a child on a surprise snow day soft fluffy snowflakes drifting gently down to blanket everything in a glimmering sheet of crystals i wish you magic pattern is a 10 stitch repeat acorns although i find acorns all through the fall i like to think of squirrels feasting on them all through the winter also it represents the other half of the legend of the holly king and the oak king i wish you abundance pattern is a 7 stitch repeat 6 advent socks poinsettia/winter rose in the language of flowers the poinsettia/winter rose symbolize good cheer and success and are said to bring wishes of mirth and celebration
